item.name: Supplier Negotiation Purchasing Documents
Supplier Negotiation Purchasing Documents/{AuctionHeaderId}/Child/Line Allocations Details
Get line allocation details for a single requisition line

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- AuctionHeaderId, RequisitionLineId and LineNumber ---for the Line Allocations Details resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Line Allocations Details. This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AuctionHeaderId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies a negotiation.
  • AwardQuantity; number; Quantity of the awarded line items.
  • AwardedLine; number; Display line number for a negotiation line in a staged purchasing document.
  • Category; string; Name of the purchasing category.
  • Item; string; Name of an inventory item.
  • ItemDescription; string; Item description associated to the purchase order line.
  • LineNumber; number; Value that uniquely identifies a line number.
  • OrderTypeLookupCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the line type basis. Values include QUANTITY, FIXED PRICE.
  • PartiallyAllocatedAwardedLinesFlag; boolean; Indicates whether an awarded line is partially allocated.
  • RequestedDeliveryDate; string; Date when the application requests to deliver the item that the negotiation line references.
  • Requisition; string; Requisition number that the negotiation line references.
  • RequisitionBusinessUnit; string; Name of the requisition purchasing unit that the application uses to set default values for each negotiation line.
  • RequisitionLine; number; Requisition line number that the negotiation line references.
  • RequisitionLineId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the associated requisition line.
  • RequisitionQuantity; number; Quantity of the requisition line items.
  • UnallocatedAwardQuantity; number; Portion of the awarded quantity that hasn't been allocated to any requisition line.
  • UnallocatedAwardedLinesFlag; boolean; Indicates whether an awarded line is unallocated.
  • UnfulfilledRequisitionQuantity; number; Unfulfilled Requisition Quantity
  • UnitOfMeasure; string; Measurement unit for a line item in a supplier negotiation.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the line allocation details according to the primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • AuctionHeaderId; integer; Value that finds line allocation details using the Auction Header ID as the primary key.
    • LineNumber; number; Value that finds line allocation details using the AwardedLine as the primary key.
    • RequisitionLineId; integer; Value that finds line allocation details using the RequisitionLineID as the primary key.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.
